titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alida Metcalf academic papers UA 303

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-02 13:11:39 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: The papers include posters made for the History 251 class in the spring of 2012 about life in Rio de Janeiro.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Alida C. Metcalf, Harris Masterson, Jr. Professor of History, teaches undergraduate and graduate courses in Latin American history. At the graduate level, she regularly offers seminars in the history of the Luso-Atlantic World, Brazil, and Colonial Latin America. Metcalf directs the Dual Degree program between the history departments of Rice and the Universidade Estadual de Campinas, Brazil, which allows highly talented graduate students to earn two Ph.Ds, one from Rice and one from UNICAMP. Metcalf's current research focuses on the history of water in Rio de Janeiro. With Fares el-Dahdah she co-directs imagineRio, a digital humanities project on the social and architectural history of Rio de Janeiro.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers include posters made for the History 251 class in the spring of 2012 about life in Rio de Janeiro.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored onsite at the Woodson Research Center.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: These materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alida Metcalf Academic Papers, 2012, UA 303, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Alida Metcalf academic papers must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University, Houston, Texas.

did.unittitle: Posters: Life in Rio de Janeiro

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Rice University architectural drawings, oversize manuscript material, maps and photographs, (UA 226-3)
